intro: Senecio whippleanus, commonly known as Whipple's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves with a fuzzy texture, and its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Senecio whippleanus is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
